tutorial.title: Homes For Sale
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to use CSS grid to create a homepage for a real estate website.

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, we'll be creating a website where users can browse homes for sale. Each home listing depends on CSS Grid for the layout, and Flexbox will be used to properly align our content.

To begin, we'll align the `header` with Flexbox. As we continue through this project, our website will gradually come together.

1. Turn the `header` element into a Flexbox container. 
2. Make the flex items display in a column.
3. Align the flex items to the center of the page.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next, apply Flexbox to the `.nav-container`.

1. Turn `.nav-container` element into a Flexbox container.
2. Center the flex content.
3. Add a value of `40px` to the margin's bottom.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Because we have `display: grid;` within `.nav`, we can go ahead and use `grid-template-columns` to create columns.

1. Using `repeat()`, create 4 columns that are equal in size with fractional units.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Begin setting up a description for our `div` elements within `.card-container` so we can define a layout for each home listing.

1. In the `.image` selector, use `image` as the grid-area name.
2. In the `.like-button` selector, use `button-one` as the grid-area name.
3. In the `.tour` selector, use `button-two` as the grid-area name.
4. In the `.description` selector, use `description` as the grid-area name.
5. In the `.address` selector, use `address` as the grid-area name.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
To put the layout together for `.home-card-1`, we'll need to define the columns and rows.

1. Use `card-one` as the grid-area name. We'll come back to this later as it will be used to further shape our website.
2. Set up the `.home-card-1` selector as a Grid container.
3. Create two columns that are both `125px`.
4. Set up Grid rows to be automatically created.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Code out `grid-template-areas` and its respective value within the `.home-card-2` selector. This is what decides the structure of our home listings. `image` will use two columns, `button-one` and `button-two` both take up one column, while `description` and `address` use two columns.

1. The grid-area name `image` should take up both columns on the first row.
2. On the next row, `button-one` and `button-two` should each take up one column.
3. On the next row, `description` should take up both columns.
4. The grid-area name `address` should take up both columns on the last row.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Put `.home-card-4` 's layout together.

1. The `.home-card-4` selector should have a grid-area name of `card-four`.
2. Turn the `.home-card-4` selector into a grid container .
3. Give `grid-template-columns` two columns at `125px`.
4. Set grid rows to `auto`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Continue putting `.home-card-4` 's layout together with `grid-template-areas`.

1. The grid-area name `image` should take up both columns on the first row.
2. On the next row, `button-one` and `button-two` should each take up one column.
3. On the next row, `description` should take up both columns.
4. The grid-area name `address` should take up both columns on the last row.
5. Include a gap of `5px` and `10px`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Notice that we have repetitive code in `style.css`. Adjust and combine the home card selectors.

1. Create a `.home-card-1, .home-card-2, .home-card-3, .home-card-4` selector **below** the `.address` selector.
2. Turn the selector into a Grid container.
3. Create two columns that are both `125px`.
4. Set up Grid rows to be automatically created.
5. Use `grid-template-areas .`
6. The grid-area name `image` should take up both columns on the first row.
7. On the next row, `button-one` and `button-two` should each take up one column.
8. Next, `description` should take up both columns and `address` should also take up both columns on the last row.
9. Include a gap of `5px` and `10px`.
10. Remove everything inside the **individual** home card selectors. The only property that should remain is `grid-area`.
